maml:description.maml:para: Creates and links and action or condition to the given parent.
The Add-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationActionOrCondition cmdlet creates and links and action or condition to the given parent.
The type of action that is to be created. This should be as per the API guide. The "EMConfigAPI.Actions" part of the action should be omitted.
The GUID of the parent to link the given action, condition or library item to.
The name to give the action or condition.
The argument list to provide to the condition/action.

When provided the given properties of the action or condition are set to the specified values. Not all actions/conditions require this, the API documentation guide will highlight when this is required.

When provided the given methods of the action or condition are called using the specified arguments. Not all actions/conditions require this, the API documentation guide will highlight when this is required.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The type of condition that is to be created. This should be as per the API guide. The "EMConfigAPI.Conditions" part of the condition should be omitted.
The GUID of the parent to link the given action, condition or library item to.
The name to give the action or condition.
The argument list to provide to the condition/action.

When provided the given properties of the action or condition are set to the specified values. Not all actions/conditions require this, the API documentation guide will highlight when this is required.

When provided the given methods of the action or condition are called using the specified arguments. Not all actions/conditions require this, the API documentation guide will highlight when this is required.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the parent to link the given action, condition or library item to.

When provided the given properties of the action or condition are set to the specified values. Not all actions/conditions require this, the API documentation guide will highlight when this is required.

When provided the given methods of the action or condition are called using the specified arguments. Not all actions/conditions require this, the API documentation guide will highlight when this is required.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The type of action that is to be created. This should be as per the API guide. The "EMConfigAPI.Actions" part of the action should be omitted.
The name to give the action or condition.
The argument list to provide to the condition/action.
The type of condition that is to be created. This should be as per the API guide. The "EMConfigAPI.Conditions" part of the condition should be omitted.
$false if an error occurs
The GUID of the created action or condition

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds a Process Name condition to the given parent. In this scenario the parent must be a node linked to the Process Started trigger point. The condition will be given the name "Notepad started" and must exactly match the process name "notepad.exe"

This example will add an Registry Set Value action to the given parent. The value to be set is HKCU\Software\testkey\testvalue. This value should be of type EXPAND_SZ and set to the value "%UserProfile%\Desktop".

This example will create a User Group condition to ensure that the user belongs to the "GLOBAL_Network Tools" group. A friendly description will be given to the condition (identified by the -Name parameter). The resulting condition will be linked to the given parent.

This example creates a Citrix Client Settings condition and links it to the given parent. The condition will be configured to ensure that the expected client OS is Android and the client version is equal to "1.2.3.4".

maml:description.maml:para: Adds Reusable Nodes to a given Node Group.
The Add-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationNodeGroupMember cmdlet adds Reusable Nodes to a given Node Group.
The GUID of the Node Group that the members should be added to.
Array of GUIDs for the Reusable Nodes that should be added as members of the Node Group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the Node Group that the members should be added to.
Array of GUIDs for the Reusable Nodes that should be added as members of the Node Group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will add a single Reusable Node to the given Node Group.
This example will add a multiple Reusable Nodes to the given Node Group.

maml:description.maml:para: Resets the in-memory configuration to default
The Clear-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfiguration cmdlet resets the in-memory configuration to default.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will remove all items in the in-memory configuration and reset to default.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialises an in-memory configuration.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfiguration cmdlet initialises an in memory configuration ready for items to be added to it.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will initialise an in-memory configuration with all defaults set.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an ElseIf expression and links it to the specified IfElse group.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationElseIfExpression creates an ElseIf expression and links it to the specified IfElse group.
The GUID of the IfElse group to add the ElseIf expression to.
The GUID for the parent of the ElseIf expression. This must be an If or ElseIf expression.
The description to give the ElseIf expression.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the IfElse group to add the ElseIf expression to.
The GUID for the parent of the ElseIf expression. This must be an If or ElseIf expression.
The description to give the ElseIf expression.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$false if an error occurs
The GUID of the added ElseIf expression

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ifGroup = New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationIfElseExpression -Parent "bd88ac67-1422-4447-b947-8a872c970be8" -GroupDescription "___ Group Description ___" -Description "___ If Description ___" -TrackTime -Verbose $elseIf = New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationElseIfExpression -IfElseGroupID $ifGroup.IfGroupGuid -Parent $ifGroup.IfExpressionGuid -Description "___ ElseIf Description ___" -TrackTime -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates an IfElse expression group and links it to the given parent. It then creates an ElseIf expression and links it to the previously created IfElse expression group.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an If group and links it to the given parent.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationIfElseExpression cmdlet creates an If group and links it to the given parent.
The GUID of the item to link the IfElse expression to.
The description to give the If expression.
The description to give the If group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the item to link the IfElse expression to.
The description to give the If expression.
The description to give the If group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$false if an error occurs
A hashtable containing the following members: -

ElseGuid = the GUID of the Else expression (used to add the conditions/actions to when evaluated to False) IfExpressionGuid = the GUID of the If expression (used to add the conditions/actions to when evaluated to True) IfGroupGuid = the GUID of the If group (used to add a condition to the expression)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an IfGroup and links it to the specified parent.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a node in the current in-memory configuration.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationNode cmdlet creates nodes in the current in-memory configuration. It will link these nodes at the given triggers or parents.
The name to be given to the node.
The GUID of the node to attach this node to.
When provided the node is created as Node Group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name to be given to the node.
When provided the node is linked to the given trigger point.
When provided the node is created as Node Group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name to be given to the node.
The GUID of the node to attach this node to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name to be given to the node.
When provided the node is linked to the given trigger point.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name to be given to the node.
The GUID of the node to attach this node to.
When provided the node is created as Node Group.
When provided the node is linked to the given trigger point.
$false if an error occurs
The GUID of the added node

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a node called "Node1" linked to the Pre-Desktop trigger.
This example creates creates a Node Group called "NodeGroup1" linked to the Pre-Session trigger.
This example creates a node called "Notepad" and links it to the Process Started trigger on the user side.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a server or Virtual Host to the Personalization Server list in the configuration.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationPersonalizationServer cmdlet adds a server or Virtual Host to the Personalization Server list in the configuration.
A friendly name to give to the added Personalization Server.
The FQDN of the server to add to the Personalization Server list.
The port number that should be used to communicate with the server. A value if 0 will use the default according to the protocol in use.
When provided the server connection will use an HTTPS connection.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
A friendly name to give to the added Personalization Server.
The FQDN of the server to add to the Personalization Server list.
The port number that should be used to communicate with the server. A value if 0 will use the default according to the protocol in use.
When provided the server connection will use an HTTPS connection.
The number of retries for the virtual host.
Timeout between the retries.
When provided the server being added is deemed to be a virtual host.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
A friendly name to give to the added Personalization Server.
The FQDN of the server to add to the Personalization Server list.
The port number that should be used to communicate with the server. A value if 0 will use the default according to the protocol in use.
When provided the server connection will use an HTTPS connection.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The number of retries for the virtual host.
Timeout between the retries.
When provided the server being added is deemed to be a virtual host.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will create a Personalization Server entry in the configuration list that uses HTTPS over port 443.
This example will add a Virtual Host to the Personalization Server list using default values for the retries and timeout.
This example will add a Virtual Host to the Personalization Server list in the configuration. It will retry 3 times with a timeout of 100ms.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a user the RunAs User library.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationRunAsUser cmdlet adds a user the RunAs User library.
The friendly name for the item being added.
The username to add.
The password for the specified user being added.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The friendly name for the item being added.
A credential object containing the username and password of the user to add.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The friendly name for the item being added.
The username to add.
The password for the specified user being added.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
A credential object containing the username and password of the user to add.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example create a RunAs User library entry for the "test" user using the given password.
This example will create a RunAs User library entry for the "TEST\testuser" account. It will prompt for a password to be entered.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the configuration to disk.
The Save-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfiguration cmdlet saves the in memory configuration to disk.
The path to save the configuration to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The path to save the configuration to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will save the configuration to the "C:\Temp\test.aemp" file

maml:description.maml:para: Enables/disables local event logging for the configuration.
The Set-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationAuditing cmdlet enables/disables local event logging for the configuration.
When provided the auditing information is sent to the standard Microsoft event log.
When provided the auditing information is sent to the AppSense event log.
When provided the auditing information is sent to a local log file.
When provided the auditing information is anonymised before storing.
The format in which to store auditing information in the local log file.
The path to the local log file. If this is not provided but local log file auditing is enabled then the default value as per the console is used.
Array of the event IDs that are to be audited. Any invalid values are ignored.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the auditing information is sent to the standard Microsoft event log.
When provided the auditing information is sent to the AppSense event log.
When provided the auditing information is sent to a local log file.
When provided the auditing information is anonymised before storing.
The format in which to store auditing information in the local log file.
The path to the local log file. If this is not provided but local log file auditing is enabled then the default value as per the console is used.
Array of the event IDs that are to be audited. Any invalid values are ignored.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example enables logging to the standard Application event log and the AppSense event log. It also enables sending to a local log file using the default location and format as per the console. Events will be anonymised before being written. Event IDs 9302 and 9303 will be enabled whilst 1000 will be ignored.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds custom settings to the configuration.
The Set-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationCustomSetting cmdlet adds custom settings to the configuration. The provided custom setting names must match those used in the console.
The name of the custom setting
The value of the custom setting. An array of values can be passed in for those settings that allow multistring values.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the custom setting
The value of the custom setting. An array of values can be passed in for those settings that allow multistring values.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will set the AddPRinterConnectionRetry custom setting to a value of 1.
This example sets the AddPrinterSequential custom setting using the default value.
This example sets the PrinterErrorCodes custom setting to "9018,9012". It does this by passing the list of required values in.

maml:description.maml:para: Allows setting of the Configuration Settings options.
The Set-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationSetting cmdlet allows setting of the Configuration Settings options.
When provided the "Mid-session config changes" option will be set to the supplied value.
When provided the "Enable individual network adapter notifications" option will be enabled.
When provided the "Enable logon sub-triggers" option will be enabled.
When provided the "Resume interrupted folder copy operations at next user logon" option will be enabled.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the "Mid-session config changes" option will be set to the supplied value.
When provided the "Enable individual network adapter notifications" option will be enabled.
When provided the "Enable logon sub-triggers" option will be enabled.
When provided the "Resume interrupted folder copy operations at next user logon" option will be enabled.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
$true if completed successfully and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will set the mid-session config changes to Immediately and disable network notifications per adapter. It will also ensure that logon sub-triggers are enabled and disabled the resumption of folder copy actions.

maml:description.maml:para: Links a previously created library item to the specified parent.
The Use-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationLibraryItem cmdlet links a previously created library item to the specified parent.
The GUID of the reusable node to link to the given parent or trigger.
The trigger point to which the Reusable Node should be linked.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the reusable node to link to the given parent or trigger.
The GUID of the parent that the Reusable Condition/Node is to be linked to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the reusable condition to link to the given parent.
The GUID of the parent that the Reusable Condition/Node is to be linked to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the reusable node to link to the given parent or trigger.
The trigger point to which the Reusable Node should be linked.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The GUID of the parent that the Reusable Condition/Node is to be linked to.
The GUID of the reusable condition to link to the given parent.
$false if an error occurs
The GUID of the linked library item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will link the specified Reusable Node to the Desktop Created trigger point.
This example will link the given Reusable Node to the given parent.
This example links the given Reusable Condition to the given parent.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new item in the configuration library section.
The New-AppSenseDesktopNowEMConfigurationLibraryItem cmdlet Creates a new item in the configuration library section.
The name to be given to the library item.
When provided the library item will be deemed a reusable node.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name to be given to the library item.
When provided the library item will be deemed a reusable condition.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name to be given to the library item.
When provided the library item will be deemed a reusable node.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the library item will be deemed a reusable condition.
$false if an error occurs
The unique ID of the added library item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a Reusable Condition named "ReusableCondition1"
This example creates a Reusable Node named "ReusableNode1".

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the given template to the given parent/trigger.
The cmdlet imports the given template to the given parent/trigger.
Path to the template file to import.
The parent node to import the template to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Path to the template file to import.
The trigger point to import the template to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Path to the template file to import.
The parent node to import the template to.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The trigger point to import the template to.
$false if an error occurs
The GUID of the top most node that was imported

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will import the template defined in "import_test.xml" to the Desktop Created trigger.
This example will import the template in "import_test.xml" to the given parent node.
